content: 14 15 times more when working the last repeat remove markers in the purl row checkpoint there are 13 14 15 16 17 pairs of shadow wrap stitches at each side heel turn the heel turn features short row with shadow wraps row 1 knit 22 23 25 26 28 swk row 2 purl 16 16 18 18 20 swp row 3 knit to shadow wrap knit both loops together swk row 4 purl to shadow wrap purl both loops together swp repeat row 3-4 4 5 5 6 6 times more crew neckline this part is worked in row shaping the instep with short row that get longer one stitch is picked up between instep and heel flap to avoid holes by working a lifted increase row 1 knit 26 28 30 32 34 knit each pair of shadow wraps together till end of sole rli instep knit 1 swk row 2 instep purl 1 sole purl to shadow wraps purl each pair of shadow wraps together till end of sole rlipurl instep purl 1 swp row 3 instep knit to end sole knit 2 ssk knit to 4 before end k2tog knit 2 instep knit to shadow wrap knit both loops of shadow wrap together knit 1 swk row 4 instep purl to end sole purl to end instep purl to shadow wrap purl poth loops of the shadow wrap together purl 1 swp repeat row 3-4 3 3 3 4 4 times more gusset for the remaining sock you are going to work in rounds set-up knit to end of instep you are now ready to work the sole this is the new beginning of your round place a lockable marker if desired it took a lot of time effort and passion to create this pattern please honor this by respecting the copyright you can work as many items as youlikeforpersonaluse butyouarenotallowedtogiftor sell copies of this pattern be it on paperorasadigitalfile also itisprohibitedtouploadthepattern toanyinternetplatform thisalsoappliestopatternsfreeofcost ©stefaniebold 2024 sneakersocksnoah-marie-page5of5 round 1 sole knit 2 ssk knit to 4 stitches before end k2tog knit 2 instep knit to shadow wrap knit both loops of the shadow wrap together x2 knit to end round 2 knit to end round 3 sole knit 2 ssk knit to 4 stitches before end k2tog knit 2 instep knit to end repeat rounds 2-3 8 9 10 10 11 times more now there are 56 60 64 68 72 stitches in total 28 30 32 34 36 each on sole and instep foot continue knitting in rounds until it is time to work the toe the toe adds 16 16 18 18 20 rounds at my gauge that is 3 5 3 5 4 4 4 5 cm / 1 ⅜ 1 ⅜ 1 ½ 1 ½ 1 ¾ inch stop working when your sock is this amount shorter than the foot length note i generally use a wedge toe because my toes are short of course you are free to use your preferred
